course.title: The Complete Node.js Developer Course (3rd Edition)
course.subtitle: Learn Node.js by building real-world applications with Node, Express, MongoDB, Jest, and more!

reviews.body: I got a deep insight into the tecnology having a lot of fun. His explanations are detailed and at a good pace. So interesting that it has become short!

You get so much from this course. The teaching is excellent and the Q&A section is really responsive. Totally worth investing for your NodeJS learning.

The important improvement I really suggest and request is to add the Front-End side of the Task App in order to complete the app given most of the learners I believe in beginner to intermediate level. For learners, this addition would make their learning much more fulfilled and it is a quite important skill being able to connect Back-End to the Front-End and making it a whole app.

This course is quite a journey. Thank you Andrew and Adam for making this course for us.
Yes it was a good match for me.

This is my first course in node js and I have liked almost every part of it. I think this course is good for rookies as well as the intermediate guys. I liked Andrew's way of teaching and he has really worked hard. I especially liked the JWT section, the deployment part, and the mini todo challenges. I am giving 4.5/5, not 5/5 because I think at the end of the course there should be a project where we can apply all we have learned that will be best and a small introduction to Javascript at the beginning of course.

This was by far the best course I've taken at Udemy so far. Andrew really knows how to teach, and I love his coding style. Most importantly, he provides challenges on most videos, really forcing you to learn the material. This, in addition to his clear and concise teaching is what really sets his course apart from all the other really good teachers on Udemy. Furthermore he covers all the essentials in his course material. I really can't find much to complain about in this course.

Taking this class was fantastic. Andrew's explanation were so easy to understand, and I like how Andrew's teaching style.

Thank you for the knowledge!

Pros:

1. Great explanations

2. Not too fast

3. Fantastic value

Cons:

1. Pace could get too slow

Fantastic value for the course and I definitely recommend it 5/5 stars

This is hands down the best Nodejs course on Udemy. It covers everything. It has helped me jump directly into Mern stack projects tutorials on Udemy. It is best for beginners as well as experience programmers. I have taken various courses on Udemy and there is no one better than Andrew when simplifying difficult concepts. Excellent course and awesome instructor!!

Edit Jan 2nd 2020:

I have now completed 100% of this course.

Rating stays intact. Super course. I think Andrew should also get the credit for me completing this course 100%. I think this is the only course where I've wacthed and rewatched every single minute.

Andrew sets a wonderful pace for the course. The challenge format really keeps the course engaging. You can't sit back and get bored as there is a challenge just around the corner.

He sets the expectations well at the beginning of the course. I think we keep hearing about someone learned webdev in 2 months and became a developer. Maybe someone did. But that is not my reality. It took me a long time to complete this course. But, you've got to find your own pace. It could take you one month or six months. You've got to learn at your own pace to be able to absorb the content.

It's not just about getting through the content. The key is absorbing the material and being able to apply it.

------

Earlier review when I was about 80% through the course:

I have a lot to say about this course and just wanted to write my review as soon as possible so that anyone out there looking for an excellent teacher to teach you nodejs can stop their search right now and get started.

Andrew deserves the Oscar for Udemy courses :) This is by far the best course I've taken on Udemy.

Here are just some reasons you should take this course:

1. The content is super updated. Seriously - every single video is relevant and everything that Andrew teaches works. No frustration and no figuring out stuff on your own.

2. Challenge format. This is one of the simplest things that instructors can do to boost learning, but Andrew is the one to implement it very well. You cannot go too far in this course without getting your hands dirty and actually learning the material.

3. Questions are answered. Given that this is one of the best selling courses on node on Udemy Andrew answers questions. I was having an issue in section 15 out of 18 sections and it would have been terrible to not get an answer at this point. But, Andrew came in and answered my question and my problem was solved this morning.

I have a couple of suggestions to make your learning in this course better:

1. Watch the videos at your own pace. Don't rush through the course. There were topics that were a little complex where I had to watch the video 2-3 times. Promises, async await, callback pattern. These are different from other programming languages.

2. Don't be afraid to go back and rewatch videos.

3. Take some time off and investigate things on your own. Maybe from some online resource to increase your learning.

But, the main thing is to stop your search for an excellent node course and jump in right now. That is why I wanted to leave this review here because I was in your spot just a month or so ago. And now I have this reference that i intend to keep coming back to.

Thank you Andrew for your hard work and wonderful teaching.

Regards,

TJ.

Great teacher, clear and precise explanations. It has a lot of contents, although so far i can't say If it covers a great amount of subject to consider a complete course. However it helps you to learn the basics.

Andrew is an amazing instructor and Adam was a great TA to see in the Q&A section. This course finally made the backend really click with me, being a frontend developer. I love all the challenges Andrew has along the way to really make sure you're coding something. Fantastic course and will probably do another one from him soon!

The course is very well organized. Andrew explains things well, shows you how to do it, then gives challenges for you to do to set up a similar functionality, then goes over that too. The course not only covered node, but he gave good reviews of other things like Postman.

instructor.name: Andrew Mead
instructor.briefIntroduction:
I'm Andrew, a full-stack developer living in beautiful Philadelphia!

I launched my first Udemy course in 2014 and had a blast teaching and helping others. Since then, I've launched 3 courses with over 110,000 students and over 18,000 5-star reviews.

I currently teach JavaScript, React, and Node.

Before I ever heard about Udemy or thought about teaching, I created a web app development company. I've helped companies of all sizes launch production web applications to their customers. I've had the honor of working with awesome companies like Siemens, Mixergy, and Parkloco.

I have a Computer Science degree from Temple University, and I've been programming for just over a decade. I love creating, programming, launching, learning, teaching, and biking.

I can't wait to see you inside one of my courses!
